learning

Class Perceptron

  • java.lang.Object
    • learning.Perceptron

  • public class Perceptron
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple perceptron for linear classification.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Perceptron(double[] weights)
      Returns a perceptron with weights (which should include the bias weight).
      Perceptron(int dimensionality)
      Produces a perceptron with dimensionality + 1 weights (including the bias weight).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int classify(Point point)
      Returns this perceptron's classification of point, 1 or -1.
      double error(java.util.List<Point> data)
      Returns the portion of points in data that are classified INCORRECTLY by this perceptron.
      (package private) double[] getWeights()
      Returns the weights of this perceptron.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Generates a random set of linearly separable data, then trains a perceptron on it.
      void train(java.util.List<Point> data)
      Trains this perceptron on data until all examples are correctly classified.
      void train(java.util.List<Point> data, int maxUpdates)
      Similar to the other version of train, but stops after maxUpdates updates even if the data are not all classified correctly.
      void trainAnimated(java.util.List<Point> data)
      Similar to train, but displays an animation of the process.
      void update(java.util.List<Point> data)
      Chooses one random misclassified point from data and updates this perceptron.
      void update(Point point)
      Updates this perceptron for the incorrectly classified point point.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Perceptron

        Perceptron(double[] weights)
        Returns a perceptron with weights (which should include the bias weight). For testing.

      • Perceptron

        public Perceptron(int dimensionality)
        Produces a perceptron with dimensionality + 1 weights (including the bias weight).

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Generates a random set of linearly separable data, then trains a perceptron on it.

      • classify

        public int classify(Point point)
        Returns this perceptron's classification of point, 1 or -1.

      • error

        public double error(java.util.List<Point> data)
        Returns the portion of points in data that are classified INCORRECTLY by this perceptron.

      • getWeights

        double[] getWeights()
        Returns the weights of this perceptron.

      • train

        public void train(java.util.List<Point> data)
        Trains this perceptron on data until all examples are correctly classified. If the data are not linearly separable, this will run forever!

      • train

        public void train(java.util.List<Point> data,
         int maxUpdates)
        Similar to the other version of train, but stops after maxUpdates updates even if the data are not all classified correctly.

      • trainAnimated

        public void trainAnimated(java.util.List<Point> data)
        Similar to train, but displays an animation of the process.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.List<Point> data)
        Chooses one random misclassified point from data and updates this perceptron. (If there are no misclassified points, the weights do not change.) As a side effect, shuffles data!

      • update

        public void update(Point point)
        Updates this perceptron for the incorrectly classified point point.
